snippet: The White House hurried Thursday to reassure Iraq that it would help its beleaguered army fend off militants who have overrun much of the country and now threaten Baghdad.
abstract: White House scrambles to reassure Iraq that it will help its beleaguered army fend off militants who have overrun much of the country and now threaten Baghdad; frenzy of activity on part of Pres Obama and his aides has yet to produce tangible American response, attesting to how swiftly crisis has erupted and how it has left stunned administration groping for response.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The White House hurried Thursday to reassure Iraq that it would help its beleaguered army fend off militants who have overrun much of the country and now threaten Baghdad.

headline.main: U.S. Scrambles to Help Iraq Fight Off Militants as Baghdad Is Threatened
headline.print_headline: U.S. Scrambles to Help Iraq Fight Off Militants

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
